item.title: Fly Tipping, 27th August
item.description:
What appear to be paint canisters and household items have been placed up against central reservation of slip road. The items are in the furthest left hand lane as you come off of the slip road for the A282 - they are close to the roundabout where traffic is often at a stand whilst waiting for the lights to change.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartford Bypass, Darenth, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned lime bike on hard shoulder A40 Westway, 27th August
item.description:
Lime bike on carriageway by hard shoulder. Driving from Ranelagh Bridge onto the A40 Westway on slip. On Carriageway Westbound. Please can this be removed immediately. Health and safety issue bikes are not permitted on the carriageway!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westway, North Kensington, City of Westminster

item.title: Flytipping - again!!!!, 27th August
item.description:
Again, the residents of Abbey Close think they're exempt from accepted conduct. Hackney Council, will you be able to get a handle on this? The heap has been there for at least 3 days.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rendlesham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Overhanging branches, 27th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Englefield Path, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light facing the wrong way, 27th August
item.description:
The centre traffic light at the junction of The Avenue with Pickhurst Lane, going in the direction of Mead Way is facing to the left and barely visible to approaching drivers. I have seen this before at this junction. A brace bar to stop it being turned (presumably by people who think it's funny) would be a good idea.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 281, Pickhurst Lane, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Hackney cleaning bags left on street, 27th August
item.description:
Hi, The road was finally swept last Thursday, thank you. 21 bags were filled by the street cleaners and left on the street to be collected. They are still there. Some are starting to split and people are dumping other rubbish on top.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Colberg Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
